page.title: 14BISHOPTHORPE JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Bishopthorpe Junior School has five classes of children, and there are 167 children in the school. The Headmaster is called Mr Matthews, and as well as the five teachers there is a secretary, a cook and two assistants, a caretaker and two cleaners, and two dinner supervisers. There is also a part time teacher, and five specialist music teachers visit the school to teach different instruments. We have a small outdoor heated swimming pool, and a large playing field area, part of which we hope to turn into a Nature Reserve. The classrooms are built around a central hall which is used for assemblies, P.E. and other activities. We use a television and the radio, and have one microcomputer.
